website_summaries.verdict: Kootek proves that sometimes the simplest, no-frills solution is the best.
pros: Cleanly designed, sturdy metal hand grip strengthener with 5 levels of resistance
cons: Some users find the resistance not great enough, even at the maximum resistance rate
Could break with repeated use as it’s an aluminum alloy

customer_reviews.title: Great in theory, not so great in execution
customer_reviews.text: In theory these are great, having one piece of equipment that will stand in for 5 is always welcome. Unfortunately the execution leaves a lot to be desired. First off, you get what you pay for. The handles are comfortable and grippy with decent knurling and the resistance on each level allows consistent progression. The feature that I was looking forward to the most falls flat. The handle nuts at the top of the handle are very difficult to break loose the first time and have never tightened properly since, leaving the handle to move freely while using them. Don't buy these expecting perfection, or even a midrange piece of equipment. These are cheap but will suffice in a pinch.
customer_reviews.author: Smk

customer_reviews.title: Weak, Definitely not that tough.
customer_reviews.text: Weak, only feels as tough as my 20 lb ones I had already. Definitely not 50 lb and absolutely not 150 lb.
customer_reviews.author: B. A.

customer_reviews.title: Failed out of the box
customer_reviews.text: The handles connect to the spring using a screw tightener similar to a drill-bit chuck. I went to loosen the handle to reduce the poundage, and the handle would not tighten enough to hold the handles on at the new, lower position. This renders the device completely useless as the handles just fall right off at any position other than full-strength. Returning immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: You get exactly what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used many pairs of grips over the years and decided why not take a chance. Quality was very poor. Adjustable metal grips on them slide off with ease. The range of motion compared to a better quality pair is just not there. Squeezing them all the way to close is not the same as any other pair I’ve tested before. For $10 you get exactly what you pay for. 150lbs doesn’t truly feel like it on these. Much weaker. Don’t waste your time.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Jones

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Some negative reviews mention that it breaks easy or wears out. I'm a large guy and have been using this for at least a month now and it feels fine still. The different resistances are very useful and I've been working my way to the strongest one. It's very easy to do while watching TV and noticeably effective. The veins in my hands are popping out more and they feel much stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S

customer_reviews.title: Decent for mild training.
customer_reviews.text: I find that this device like many other things on Amazon are not as great as the deem themselves. I expect this often, this device does just that. It is very durable and has a good grip, but as others have stated, the tension adjuster is not very accurate. For people who just want to strengthen their grip, this is perfect for you. But for tough training, I suggest higher quality. One of the problems I did face with this is that when you adjust the tension, one side does not tighten very easily. So if you have pliers handy then it should be no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amy B Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Kootec work out forearm and finger hand grip
customer_reviews.text: After doing 30 - 50 repetitions with this steel hand grip I was fully satisfied you do feel the burn of your forearms while working out it has really good resistance when you squeeze it together. I like how it adjust to different levels 50 lb through 150 lb I also like the chrome finish and the steel look thank you Amazon for such a great product ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
customer_reviews.author: ANTHONY

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I knew instantly when I opened this that I didn't like it. It seems pretty heavy duty, but it quickly became apparent that it isn't put together very well. I can't get the hand grips to stay in place after I've loosened, adjusted, and re-tightened them. I accidentally pulled one completely off and had a heck of a time getting it back on. Maybe I just got a lemon, but I'm not impressed. It's going back.
customer_reviews.author: akbassman

customer_reviews.title: Not the poundage on the grippers
customer_reviews.text: These are good grippers for beginners but the poundage is wrong they claim 150 LBs but that is not true at all. Compared to the captains of crush which are a premium gripper these pound claims are off. I would say the max pounds on this gripper is 120 LB which is equal to a captains of crush point 5. Still a good gripper but I think paying more money for the captains of crush grippers is a better investment if your serious about grip strength.
customer_reviews.author: FuriousFern

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my dad for father's day. He has this thing in his hands all the time now. I remember when I was little he always had one. He's always been a exercise nut. But he loves it. He lives that you can change the pounds etc. It's well used and very sturdy. Solid heavy metal. Excellent
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre
customer_reviews.text: The piece of metal is pretty skinny. The design is cool. I don’t think the weight range is accurate or I’m just stronger than I think. It now has a creaking noise. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Duy

customer_reviews.title: Great to help with ADD!
customer_reviews.text: Got these for strength and ended up using them when I was having trouble focusing. Now I'm strengthening my hands and giving them something to do so I can pay attention. I like the simplicity of design. I would say that if you have small hands though, these may be a bit big for you. Luckily I'm a gal with very long fingers so it worked for me.
customer_reviews.author: Yankee in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The adjustment mechanism doesn't work well at all. The whole piece of gear is very poor quality. This was definitely a lesson in "you get what you pay for". I can't believe anyone would want this POS. I tried to send it back but the website return function is down. Predictable
customer_reviews.author: BRSR

customer_reviews.title: Works well, does what it says, but the handle is rougher then sandpaper.
customer_reviews.text: I've used grip exercisers for decades and needed a new one. The adjustability works well and it has full range of motion. However, the grip downright hurts after about 15 reps. I'm a weightlifter and my palms have solid calluses. I say that to point out that I'm used to things like that, and it still hurts. I plan to put some grip tape on it.
customer_reviews.author: TheAvo

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for wife to large for her hand
customer_reviews.text: Overall I did not care for this product and would not order again, but did not bother to send back either. It was described and I choose it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good hand strengthener.
customer_reviews.text: My son wanted to strengthen his grip - after reading reviews, this one stood out as a good product. He enjoys using it and says that the grip works as expected.
customer_reviews.author: VictoriaL

customer_reviews.title: Price was very good
customer_reviews.text: You can adjust this item to fir your hand, however I experienced one side would not stay tightened.
customer_reviews.author: leonard nieves sr

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: The handles have a tendency to slip down until you really tighten them up. Otherwise a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia B.

customer_reviews.title: Either my other grip trainer is way underrated or this one is way over rated.
customer_reviews.text: Long story short, this grip trainer is MUCH easier to close then another one I got that is also rated for 150lb. In fact it feels close to another trainer I have that is rated at 90lb. If I had to guess it maxes out a bit over 100lb. Besides that it works fine and does what it says but I am looking for something stronger then what I have now.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Collum

customer_reviews.title: Good enough - sleeves will fall off though
customer_reviews.text: Good enough variable grip trainer; needs a stopping pin so the sleeves don’t slide all the way off.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey D. Esposito

customer_reviews.title: Well priced functional item
customer_reviews.text: Well price grip exerciser. Would be better if grip were plastic or rubber to ease stress on the hands.
customer_reviews.author: DMC1

customer_reviews.title: simple
customer_reviews.text: easy to use and adjust, I use it when I drive long distance to keep my mind busy, and my forearms yolked! lol
customer_reviews.author: Average joe review

customer_reviews.title: Locking feature fixed!
customer_reviews.text: I received an upgraded gripper. This one adjusts and locks well. Thanks for continuing to improve your product.
customer_reviews.author: T. P. Viau

customer_reviews.title: The adjustable handles suck
customer_reviews.text: The adjustable handles do not work very well, also it is just way too easy at 150 lbs, it could also be that I was given God like strength, it was like I was squeezing 1 lb, overall though it's good to build strength.
customer_reviews.author: Shellie-Marie Eaton

customer_reviews.title: It may just be me, but its not enough weight for my hands
customer_reviews.text: I can easily touch the ends on these, on both hands, with no practice, which I have no idea if is above average or normal (at 150lb setting).
customer_reviews.author: calvin

customer_reviews.title: Overall good value
customer_reviews.text: Like the adjustability. Dislike inability to completely tighten one adjusters.
customer_reviews.author: Robin W. Coffey

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy
customer_reviews.text: Broke after a week. Tried to fix it ourselves & couldn't. Ordered another brand.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I liked the quality of the product, the prompt action on our order, the instructions that came with the device. The only negative is the knurled metal handles. Takes some getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: Desert dweller

customer_reviews.title: 3 stars I guess
customer_reviews.text: Tends to loosen as you use it. The resistance is chosen by unscrewing the bottom portion of the grip. Other than that obviously flaw it functions as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Matt M.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to adjust, and they feel like they're giving me the proper resistance. All-metal design feels sturdy and durable.
customer_reviews.author: OKnight

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: I find this to be to stiff for every day use for my arthritis
customer_reviews.author: Steve Lunsford

customer_reviews.title: Excited
customer_reviews.text: I think it's goingg to do the job especially for the range of motion I need.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: I had been having some weakness in my left hand but this is really helping.
customer_reviews.author: Senyo Dabo

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality!
customer_reviews.text: A very high quality, adjustable hand exerciser. I was quite impressed especially considering the low price.
customer_reviews.author: shopper1

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Definitely fit all of my needs. Well made!
customer_reviews.author: Kelso

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable!
customer_reviews.text: Adjustable grip is really nice, allows you to re-size for hand or to change tension. Nice grip and durable. Definitely would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Kraft

customer_reviews.title: Dose the work
customer_reviews.text: It has a poor quality but still does the work and it’s cheap
customer_reviews.author: Omarbaashaa

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable but efficient
customer_reviews.text: I understand it wasn’t expensive which is why I would still recommend this I just have to say I find it very uncomfortable to use. Gets the job done if you’re hardcore... not for me lol but definitely gonna hold up a while and it’s not too large either
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Smith

customer_reviews.title: Everything you can think of and more
customer_reviews.text: Words cannot describe how great this product is. It is everything you can think of and even better. I have been struggling to find a grip equipment this good especially since the gyms have been closed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't think it's a bargin!
customer_reviews.text: I know it's only 9.99...save your money! Handles do not tighten so they fall off or are moving around.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Schoenfelder

customer_reviews.title: Tolerances need refinement
customer_reviews.text: Adjustment feature requires refinement as 1 leg cannot tighten done to hold desired measurement selection without over torquing using pliers. Bought two, the other one holds when tightening just by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy these, unsafe.
customer_reviews.text: The handles don’t tighten down properly and on high tension it actually shot off the handles and almost broke my tv. Do not buy this, I’m returning them for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Roah

customer_reviews.title: Not 150 lbs
customer_reviews.text: This is very bad. I have a gold's gym hand gripper 20-90lbs and it's definitely harder than this.... I wouldn't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Not good for doing grip strengthing if you don't have a soft Handel.
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the first product that I was dissatisfied with Amazon, because when I wanted to change the grip strength the Handel part came out, also it hurts the hand in continuously useing it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dose what it's supose to.....
customer_reviews.text: Was good for what I wanted it for, but the handles were uncomfortable. Very rough surface s....
customer_reviews.author: Othel Park

customer_reviews.title: product defect
customer_reviews.text: Product is great for about a month of use. Then the spring weakens and it breaks. I have bought this product many times and the same thing occurs each time. if you fix this, you would have a better product. Also, someone could get hurt when spring breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Frias

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this POS
customer_reviews.text: Terrible don’t buy, Handel falls off and will not lock on.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Depending on you see it!
customer_reviews.text: When it first arrived it was great! A few problems did occur such as adjusting it will cause it to be loose so be mindful of that and it’s somewhat a problem that it slightly moves but for me I won’t make a fuss out of it
customer_reviews.author: Julian Contreras

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Went to adjust the grips and was dissapointed when the grips dont really lock into place even when tightened down they still are able to slide pretty easily
customer_reviews.author: Tristan Nation

customer_reviews.title: broke in first 3 months
customer_reviews.text: this item broke after normal use in the first 3 months! the last one I owned lasted 20 years of use! of course it was a different brand. I am very disapointed. I am 62 years old so don't know how I could have broke this!
customer_reviews.author: Holly D.

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a couple months worth of use.
customer_reviews.text: Product snapped on the 150# setting. I had only had it on the 150# for about a week, because I usually just kept it only 125#. Pretty disappointed in it not lasting long at all. I'd look for something more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: Works, but it's kind of crappy if you're already decently strong. 150 lbs doesn't feel like 150lbs at all. More like 100 or 120. Find yourself some some CoC grippers.
customer_reviews.author: Jed

customer_reviews.title: Buy this
customer_reviews.text: I'm a climber and this really helps in my "training regiment" in SoCal. The only thing I wish for is that it went past 150 lbs. Maybe 300? Make it hard for us "weak people", please! 5 stars all the way down...
customer_reviews.author: Wojtek W

customer_reviews.title: Good device, nice to have when you're just doing nothing
customer_reviews.text: Solid product, adjusts easy. Very good for sitting on the couch and doing some squeezes
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: Great it is great to be able to adjust the tension!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: adjustment
customer_reviews.text: the adjustments are hard to lock into place and often they wont stay. other than that its a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Rlesh1

customer_reviews.title: CRAP
customer_reviews.text: on arrival upon adjusting the resistance level the two handles fell off and could not be reattached- any way we tried. Just out of the box
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Strong hands
customer_reviews.text: Fits my hand perfect like the way they look thank you
customer_reviews.author: Allen Lewis

customer_reviews.title: worth 4-5 dollars
customer_reviews.text: decent for type cause there adjustable but other than that there not worth it and they slide up and down
customer_reviews.author: r.hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Great gripper. Its a bit hard to get the things to not slide sometimes but other than that its perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Parkinson

customer_reviews.title: Pumping up my Popeyes
customer_reviews.text: The adjustable tension was a surprise plus. Love the iron grip.
customer_reviews.author: Decater

customer_reviews.title: Would buy
customer_reviews.text: definitely not 150 pounds its too easy and after 2-4 pumps hands bruise from the grips. Still a good item tho
customer_reviews.author: b r u h    m o m e n t

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: The goods are received, I like them very much, the quality is great
customer_reviews.author: Jack Balmer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for hand strength  !
customer_reviews.text: I like that its adjustable and very sturdy and works perfectly for what I need
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: It Broke.
customer_reviews.text: My gripper broke after 2 months of normal use. About to submit a claim to see if they stand behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: James Dougherty

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gotta try them.
customer_reviews.text: Love these, I broke my others but seen that the strength changes n that's helps alot.
customer_reviews.author: Star

customer_reviews.title: Good grip
customer_reviews.text: Great quality a little tough to lock into place on a certain weight resistance.
customer_reviews.author: Nick howard

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Good price and good product! Love how you can change the level.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not 150lbs.
customer_reviews.text: No where near 150lbs of resistance. Handles slide up and down the spring even when its tight. Not a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: One side of grip will not tighten and stay in place at setting desired. Grip handle will slide off.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Manchester

customer_reviews.title: Hand grip
customer_reviews.text: My refund should have been back into my debit account I do not see it why
customer_reviews.author: oliver  mcpherson

customer_reviews.title: simplistic.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. I use to strengthen my forearms and wrists for rock climbing.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Snook

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality of product.
customer_reviews.text: It is less thn 4 months old and it is broken.
customer_reviews.author: kintan

customer_reviews.title: Made pretty cheap.
customer_reviews.text: It slips a lot often adjusting and broke after 3-4 months.
customer_reviews.author: luckner roseme

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend for athletes.
customer_reviews.text: I definitely appreciate this device, and for the price it can’t be beat. I travel a lot for work, by car, and so I might as well get some kind of workout in as I do so. This grip trainer is EXHAUSTING if used regularly. 150 lbs is a great starter resistance to build towards the COC set and it has definitely improved my hand strength.
customer_reviews.author: texasfamdamily

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: As described, quick shipping. Extended warranty offered by visiting website.
customer_reviews.author: joel ruprecht

product_meta.title: Kootek 50-150 Lbs Hand Grip Strengthener Adjustable Resistance Hand Exerciser Forearm Gripper Finger Strength Trainer Workout Kit for Athletes and Musicians (1 Pack)
feature_bullets: Durable and Sturdy: Made of heavy duty aluminium alloy, perfect gripper for improving strength and flexibility of your hands, fingers, wrist and forearms. Ideal for musicians, athletes, golfers, rock climbers, tennis players, office worker.

Adjustable Resistance: Providing 5 levels ( 50-75-100-125-150 Lbs ) of resistances, you can select the right levels based on your specific needs and goals, enhance your the strength effectively. Suitable for man, woman, seniors and teens who have different strength.

Kootek hand exerciser work great for rehabilitation and stress relief, if you suffer from muscles bone stiffness, rheumatoid arthritis, arthropathy, tendonitis, carpal tunnel, tennis elbow, fingers wrist injury and are on the way of recovery from a fractured or broken wrist, or tendon surgery.

Portable and lightweight design ( 5.5 inch, 0.46 lb), easy to pop into your pocket or backpack, allow you exercise your hand anywhere and anytime, such at home, gym, office, or when you take a walk, watch TV, outdoor and travel.

Constructed with anti-slip handles, easy to adjust resistance and use. ( Note: no need to release handles thoroughly when you adjust resistance, if the resistance bar falling out of tube, please matching the semicircle hole then reinsert it.)
